Subject: duplicated crawling resource by following "Content-Location" referal
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=225068648

      my seed list contains a URL : "http://www.debian.org/". When I 
fetch the URL then its http response header field contains 
"Content-Location: http://www.debian.org/index.en.html" field. Then 
Heritrix's 'extractHTTP' module extract the latter URL and insert it 
into crawl frontier, with the same priority as 301(2) referal, though in 
this case its fetch status is 200. Because 'Content-Location' is meant 
to supply the original resource presentation with respect to the request 
URL, following such newly discovered URL doesn't seem make sense, 
because both URLs refer to the same resource exactly. The ideal approach 
to this problem seem to make the two URLs as if they are the same, maybe 
exploiting additional database to store such information.
      Can you think of a means to avoid downloading the same resource 
twice  and  at the same time to avoid further duplicated crawling in the 
future?
